page.title: 01Surrey Hampshire Border
page.content: The area falls into three sections: (a) Woodland-majority owned by Forestry commission. Alice Holt Lodge is one of two research stations serving in the British isles in all aspects of forest technology. Forest has both coniferous and deciduous trees, picnic sites, pond (fishing), nature trails for public recreation. Deer, foxes, grey squirrels are common sights. Public attraction: 'Bird World' housing collection of over 100 species (approximately 1.000 birds) from all ovet the world. (b) Farmland arable crops/grazing land for cattle. Boundries marked by hedgerows/wire and post fencing. (c) Semi-rural area with Rowledge village: 2 churches, 7 shops, 1 garage 2 pubs and 2 bus services.
